meanings.sent1: She prewarns her friends about the upcoming test.
meanings.sent2: The weather forecast prewarns of a storm approaching.
meanings.sent3: The cat prewarns the birds by chirping loudly.
meanings.sent4: The teacher prewarns the students about the difficult assignment.
meanings.sent5: The alarm system prewarns of any potential danger.

meanings.definition: To give advance notice or warning.
meanings.sent1: He prewarns his colleagues about the change in schedule.
meanings.sent2: The signs on the road prewarn drivers of construction ahead.
meanings.sent3: The dog prewarns the family by barking at strangers.
meanings.sent4: The app prewarns users of any suspicious activity.
meanings.sent5: The smoke detector prewarns of a possible fire.
